A psychosocial assessment is systematically carried out alongside the medical assessment.

A personalised safety plan is drawn up with the patient and their parents. This safety plan is a list of resources (resource persons, emergency telephone number, calming activities, reassurance techniques, etc.) that the patient can use before and during a suicidal crisis.

Involving parents in the care process is essential; they need to be made aware of the need for a safe environment (limiting access to lethal means).

question.title: What is a key component of a safety plan for individuals at risk of suicidal behavior?
question.description: A safety plan is a list of resources that the patient can use before and during a suicidal crisis. What is a key component of this list?

option_a.title: A list of emergency telephone numbers
option_a.description: This option is a plausible distractor that may be tempting to choose, but it is not the correct answer

option_b.title: A list of calming activities
option_b.description: This option is partially correct, but not the most critical component of a safety plan
